labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on managing and automating interactions with Google Workspace services, particularly Gmail and Google Calendar. It provides tools for retrieving and manipulating data from Google Chat spaces, including messages, membership details, and space information. The server facilitates programmatic access to these Google services, enabling users to automate tasks, filter messages with natural language processing, and integrate these features into broader applications.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Communication Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing communications (messages, memberships, and spaces) within Google Chat, which is a communication platform. The secondary label "API Integration" is selected because the server heavily relies on interacting with Google's APIs to perform its functions. The secondary label "Daily Productivity" is also relevant due to the automation capabilities that enhance user productivity. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Google Workspace Server
server_info_crawled.author: @KaranThink41/google_chat_mcp_server
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your emails and calendar events programmatically through a unified interface. Interact with Gmail and Calendar APIs seamlessly to automate tasks and enhance productivity. Simplify your workflow by integrating Google services into your applications effortlessly.

tools.name: post_text_message
tools.description: Deploy Server Google Workspace Server @KaranThink41/google_chat_mcp_server Try in Playground post_text_message

tools.name: fetch_member_details
tools.description: Retrieve detailed membership information from a Google Chat space. See: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces.members/get

tools.name: fetch_space_details
tools.description: Get comprehensive details about a specific Google Chat space. Documentation: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces/get

tools.name: list_space_memberships
tools.description: List all memberships in a Google Chat space along with detailed role and membership status. Documentation: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces.members/list

tools.name: list_space_messages
tools.description: Retrieve a list of messages from a Google Chat space, including those from blocked members and spaces. Refer to: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces.messages/list. Optional filters like 'Monday', 'manager message', 'Rahul message', etc. can be applied via custom logic.

tools.name: fetch_message_details
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific message in a Google Chat space. See: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces.messages/get

tools.name: list_joined_spaces
tools.description: List all Google Chat spaces that the caller is a member of. Group chats and DMs are listed only after the first message is sent. Documentation: https://developers.google.com/chat/api/reference/rest/v1/spaces/list

tools.name: apply_natural_language_filter
tools.description: Convert a natural language filter query (e.g., 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Rahul message', 'manager message', etc.) into a standardized filter string that can be used with other tools. This tool helps in mapping human-friendly filter terms to API query parameters.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@KaranThink41/google_chat_mcp_server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: googleClientSecret
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: OAuth Client Secret from Google Cloud Console
